CatDescriptText: Miss Mildred Johnson, 439 Beaver Street, Sewickley, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 14, 1958, pg. 8 with question: �Do you think ministers should invest in business enterprises for profit, or become executives or directors of such concern?� answer reads: �Yes, because they have that right like everybody else.�
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mildred Johnson wearing hat, light colored ruffled blouse, light colored jacket, and diagonally striped skirt, holding dark handbag and umbrella, standing in front of store with mannequin in window, streetcar in background
